result.markdown:
---
title: "Row functions"
---

There four main verbs (i.e. functions) to manipulate rows. These are:

- `arrange()`:
- `distinct()`:
- `filter()`:
- `slice()`:

## Dataset

For demostration we'll load the `knz_bison` data from the [lterdatasampler package](/datasets/lterdatasampler.qmd) (hyperlink includes install instructions) and view it.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Load package
library("lterdatasampler")
#arc_weather tibble
tibble::as_tibble(lterdatasampler::knz_bison)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8,325 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1994        11       8 813         F                    890
 2 CBH01         1994        11       8 834         F                   1074
 3 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-301       F                   1060
 4 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-402       F                    989
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-403       F                   1062
 6 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-502       F                    978
 7 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-503       F                   1068
 8 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-504       F                   1024
 9 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-601       F                    978
10 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-602       F                   1188
# ℹ 8,315 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```


:::
:::


## Arrange

The `dplyr::arrange()` function allows you to arrange the rows of a __tibble__.

### Numeric columns

Arrange the __tibble__ by rec_year (note seemingly won't change):


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(knz_bison, rec_year)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8,325 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1994        11       8 813         F                    890
 2 CBH01         1994        11       8 834         F                   1074
 3 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-301       F                   1060
 4 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-402       F                    989
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-403       F                   1062
 6 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-502       F                    978
 7 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-503       F                   1068
 8 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-504       F                   1024
 9 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-601       F                    978
10 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-602       F                   1188
# ℹ 8,315 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```


:::
:::


`dplyr::arrange()` will arrange the rows by the selected column in ascednign fashion (lowest to highest). You can use the `desc()` function on columns you wan't to be orded in descing fashion.

Arrange the __tibble__ by rec_year in descending fashion (note seemingly won't change):


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(knz_bison, desc(rec_year))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8,325 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-316       F                   1045
 2 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-358       F                   1110
 3 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-411       F                    825
 4 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-422       F                    930
 5 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-501       F                   1000
 6 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-527       F                    970
 7 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-573       F                   1065
 8 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-6008      F                   1110
 9 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-605       F                   1050
10 CBH01         2020        10      29 Y-616       F                   1105
# ℹ 8,315 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```


:::
:::


### String columns

Strings are order by alphabetical order.

Default is from A-Z (ascending).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(knz_bison, animal_sex)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8,325 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1994        11       8 813         F                    890
 2 CBH01         1994        11       8 834         F                   1074
 3 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-301       F                   1060
 4 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-402       F                    989
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-403       F                   1062
 6 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-502       F                    978
 7 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-503       F                   1068
 8 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-504       F                   1024
 9 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-601       F                    978
10 CBH01         1994        11       8 B-602       F                   1188
# ℹ 8,315 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```


:::
:::


Set it to descing will order it from Z-A.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dplyr::arrange(knz_bison, desc(animal_sex))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 8,325 × 8
   data_code rec_year rec_month rec_day animal_code animal_sex animal_weight
   <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
 1 CBH01         1994        11       8 910         M                    982
 2 CBH01         1994        11       8 91C         M                   1020
 3 CBH01         1994        11       8 91F         M                   1050
 4 CBH01         1994        11       8 91H         M                   1037
 5 CBH01         1994        11       8 91J         M                   1104
 6 CBH01         1994        11       8 91K         M                   1306
 7 CBH01         1994        11       8 91L         M                   1122
 8 CBH01         1994        11       8 91M         M                   1136
 9 CBH01         1994        11       8 91P         M                    996
10 CBH01         1994        11       8 91W         M                    954
# ℹ 8,315 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: animal_yob <dbl>
```


:::
:::
